original_body_lines: This week I’m giving you some beauty tips for glowing skin and these remedies can all be done at home!
Make a face mask by grating a cucumber and mixing it with 03 tablespoons of yoghurt.
Apply this mask to your face, leave it on for 05 minutes and then rinse off with cold water.

Take a small amount of coconut oil, warm it up between your hands, and massage it onto your face. Wait a few minutes before washing it off with your regular cleanser. You can also leave this home remedy on overnight and wash it off the next morning.

For this home remedy, mix 01 teaspoon of baking soda with a teaspoon of olive oil, and half a spoon of honey. Wet your face and apply this mixture with gentle circular motions. Rinse off with cool water.

Your diet should include some fresh fruits and vegetables that are consumed every single day. Good fruits for glowing skin include oranges, bananas, mangoes, and kiwis. For the vegetables, try eating carrots, broccoli, and tomatoes. If you don’t love eating fruits and vegetables, these can also be consumed in the form of a delicious smoothie.

If you have dry skin, the reason might be that you are not drinking enough water. After all, your body requires a lot of water to function normally. To keep your skin cells hydrated, you need to supply them with fresh water every single day. You are recommended to drink at least 08 glasses of water each day.

Sleep is an easy but powerful beauty tip for glowing skin. Be sure to get eat least 08 hours of sleep each night. While we sleep, the damaged cells of our body are repaired, replaced, and replenished. If you don’t sleep enough, your skin cells will be tired and look dry all the time. A lack of sleep will catch up with you quickly, forming dark circles under your eyes and exacerbating other skin conditions.
